page.title: 01St Annes -Historical Origins
page.content: In the 12C,Richard Fitzroger gave his estate at Lethun (Lidun in Domesday) to Benedictine monks. After the Reformation the estate changed hands until 1606 when it came to Sir Cuthbert Clifton whose successor,John Talbot Clifton esq, leased a part of what was Lytham Common,much of it sand-hills,to a company of gentlemen for 999 years. The idea behind St Annes was that of wealthy cotton magnates who aimed to develop the flat area behind the sand hills & build fine mansions from which to travel daily to Manchester & to retire to.Changes in the economic climate beginning in the cotton slump of the 1920's and 1930's began slowly to alter the prosperous little town.Modern hotels and flats are now dominant,but some uniqueness has been retained.
